[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Trait: CryptoHash for SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Hasher type] Can the SparseMerkleLeafNodeHasher be substituted with a malicious implementation to break the cryptographic properties of the tree? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: SparseMerkleLeafNode::hash()] [Update order] Does updating state with key first (line 126) then value_hash (line 127) provide collision resistance, or can attackers find (key1, value1) and (key2, value2) pairs with the same hash? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Derive: Serialize, Deserialize for SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Serialization attack] Can an attacker craft malicious serialized data that deserializes into a SparseMerkleLeafNode with inconsistent key/value_hash relationships? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::hash()] [Hash output size] Does the hasher guarantee a fixed output size, or could variable-length outputs cause tree structure ambiguity? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: TransactionAccumulatorInternalNode] [Hasher consistency] Are TransactionAccumulatorHasher instances consistent across all validators, or can hasher variations cause different accumulator roots? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: SparseMerkleInternalNode] [State tree integrity] Does SparseMerkleInternalHasher match the hasher used in AptosDB storage layer, preventing state root mismatches? (Critical)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: EventAccumulatorInternalNode] [Event ordering] Can event accumulator proofs be manipulated to reorder events within a transaction, breaking causality? (High)
